intro: Hedyotis lindleyana var. yakusimensis, commonly known as the Yakushima variant of the small-flowered bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable species in the study of alpine and subtropical flora.
